phrases: I was thinking about this story.
The series of strange tales that started in November of 1930.
Once, we traveled together on a train, did not we, Carol?
Do you remember what I said to you at the time?
From the time that we were children, we have thought of rainbows
as being beautiful things, without any doubts at all.
People who do not know about the refraction of light
may also think of it as a harbinger of a natural disaster.
The vegetation may be burning up at the base of that rainbow.
Why is it that we feel a sense of fairy tales
from that bit of seven-colored information?
Have you ever thought about that?
I mean, even if I did think about it, I could not tell,
and besides, our job is not to think about things,
but to report to others the outcome of what has already happened.
It is true, our job is to convey the truth to others,
but the moment that we obtain any information, be it truth or falsehood,
We must not stop at just determining
whether the information is true or false.
Such is the responsibility of those who deliver information to others.
But, what is there to think about?
Just thinking about something does not change whether or not it is true, right?
A story is neither information, nor is it accumulated information.
It is the result of what has been thought.
Carol, why did you think that these stories started in November, 1930?
And you call yourself the assistant
to Gustave Saint-Germain, Vice President of the Daily Days?
and it would be best to start inside the Advenna A vis, as it crosses the Atlantic.
it might be best to start with the nasty business
that happened aboard the transcontinental Flying Pussyfoot,
you have chosen November of 1930 as the start of the story.
Mr. Vice President, it is because...
It is because, you see, I thought about what would be easiest to understand.
It was at that point when these incidents first came before our eyes.
Indeed, it is easier to understand.
you should think about more than just the time axis.
What if we were to look at that eccentric pair of robbers
the young lad, suffering with a cursed destiny?
the Gandor Family's brilliant young capo?
If that is what you mean...
Please, do you have any charity to offer?
The Lord is watching your actions.
In time, the Lord will judge your actions...
I am in a good mood today.
The Lord is sure to bless your actions!
Quit being so pious only when it suits you, old-timer.
I have some flowers I picked this morning, to thank you.
I am not so sure about that... sir!
Well, he is pretty close, is not he?
Did you know that I was Firo Prochainezo, of the Martillo Family,
You may indeed be right about that.
Still, Carol, depending upon whom you focus on,
the same incident switches form in an ever-changing manner.
In other words, there is one incident,
but there are as many stories about it as there are people involved.
No need for warnings or negotiating!
Nobody else exists in our world!
Gandors, Martillos, it does not matter!
Crush them till there is nothing left!
Make it as though they utterly never existed!
So, what became of that idiot, Luck?
He is seeing if he still has enough sensitivity left to feel any pain.
A gambling parlor, a bar, and a ticket window.
I am going to blow them away!
We dragged back one of the guys that went after the ticket window.
You are the bastard that came after our turf, are you?!
You have got a lot of spunk, huh?
So you are saying, it starts when the Mafia and the Camorra go after each other?
Luck Gandor has been put to sleep.
Word was that he was pretty capable, but it was child's play.
The Gandors are a small-time outfit, anyway.
It will not take much trouble to wipe them out.
We have made arrangements to purchase some newer, special bombs from certain sources,
so in time, we will also round up the Martillos.
There is something that I need you to do.
it would not be too surprising for us to be the ones at the start of this story.
He is the second son of the Genoard family.
He is the son of Raymond Genoard, whom you killed on your own,
Dallas Genoard is the younger brother of Geoffrey Genoard,
whom you also killed on your own.
He said that you are the one who killed his father and brother, Gustavo.
He also says that he has proof.
I even paid off the court officers.
There is no way there is any proof.
Then how is it that Dallas named you?
Find him, and bring him here.
Find him as soon as possible.
Do I get to decide whether he comes in dead or alive?
Find that despicable second son of the Genoards!
He is going to pay for making a fool of me, Gustavo,
He is going to pay for making a fool of me, Gustavo, What a wretched man.
Where is the nerve you had when you attacked our territory?!
You were ready to answer for this, were not you?!
You look like you have seen a ghost.
You are... supposed to be dead...
I need to ask you to do one more.
But I have not washed off the blood and grease from the last one yet.
So I think it is going to hurt an awful lot.
Just do not let that freak near me!
Who was it that turned me into a honeycomb?
You look creepy when you smirk like that.
Thy soul shall find itself alone
'Mid dark thoughts of the grey tomb-stone;
Not one, of all the crowd, to pry
Long ago, I was so scared of this poem, I could not stand it.
But that is not the case now.
Not since the incident a year ago.
Maybe because as much as I have lost any need to be afraid,
I have also lost any feelings of anxiety.
Firo, do not you think anything of it?
there is been an unusual bunch that has been hanging around on our turf lately.
Probably some guys who have the Runoratas backing them.
I will be there to help you, whenever it hits the fan.
Firo, please, pretend you do not know.
That is a pretty standoffish thing to ask.
I am not going to put the Martillos out.
Arriving on the Flying Pussyfoot tomorrow.
In that case, Isaac and Miria are on the same train.
One of Maiza- san's old friends is aboard, too.
Then, let us go pick them up together-
but there is no mistake that they were passengers aboard the Flying Pussyfoot.
How many bodies does that make?
The number we have discovered is somewhere in the teens.
They have been left along the side of the tracks here and there over several dozen kilometers.
Inspectors, what on earth happened here?
You are better off not knowing.
Looks like they were aboard, all right.
Their names were on the passenger list at the station in Chicago.
Our orders are to investigate that next.
You think we can keep an incident like this covered up?
There appears to be a survivor among the passengers that fell out.
There is no way you can still be alive...
At least let me do this much.
I will pay for the damages.
So what you saw here today...
Besides, if I ever did tell anyone, they would put me in a sanatorium, at best!
it does not look like we can ignore this.
The Flying Pussyfoot is quite an unusual train, huh?
I have seen it once before and it is overly ornamental, to put it one way.
If I had to say, it looks kind of ostentatious.
I want to see it even more, now.
There was an announcement a moment ago that the Flying Pussyfoot had a breakdown,
and all the passenger cars were switched to another train.
Either way, the lead car will be switched with a smokeless,
electric engine before it enters Manhattan,
so you will not be able to see the whole thing.
Oh, by the way, what kind of person is this old friend of yours, Maiza- san?
He tries to carry everything on his shoulders, despite being so introverted.
That is the type of person he is.
The type who would not last long, were they a normal person, huh?
Claire is the same way, for the opposite reason.
Would you decide whether you are just going to stare, or if you are going to take me in?
Despite appearances, I am in a pretty foul mood.
If I would known this would happen, I would have killed you sooner.
Or would you like me to kill you, right here?
You saying you do not want to be killed by me?!
Please, can we go a little slower?
Long time no see, my fine fellows!
I am so glad to see you are all doing so well!
You too, Isaac- san and Miria- san.
Live long enough, and I will tell you someday!
Looking up at the starry sky that goes on forever, we sing
a melody of a dream we have of our limited eternity
The water of adoration, overflowing in our hearts
will reach someone in the distant future
our voices calling out will someday become a great song
We can go on spinning our love
though it may still be such a tiny light now
Hey, Miria, where could this asideplace be?
It means not at home, right?
Which means that it is somewhere not at home, right?
I am sure it is aside, where the old woman's qualms are.
